param.name: file_id
param.doc: The existing JMT configuration file name.

method.name: PUT
method.doc: To update an existing JMT configuration file with the RESTful web service, issue an HTTP PUT command on the JMT Configuration File resource URI.

param.name: Accept:application/json
param.doc: Required for requests to the service

param.name: id
param.doc: File id of the resource to updated.

param.name: jmt_config_file
param.doc: The file that contains the data to be saved into the existing JMT configuration file.

param.name: jmt_config_data
param.doc: The data that is saved into the existing JMT configuration file.

response.doc:
200 ok
Note: For the changes to take effect, they must be deployed as described in Configuration changes commit process.
There is a problem with the request. The JSON message describes the problem.
File not Found, The requested service does not exist. The JSON message indicates which resource.
An internal error occurred. The JSON message indicates the problem.
